page.title: 01 The Village of St. Cleer.
page.content: St. Cleer is a village of about 3,000 inhabitants in East Cornwall, three miles north of Liskeard. It is on the edge of Bodmin Moor, 700 feet above sea level. In the centre of the village the houses are old, because it is in the middle of an old tin and copper mining area, but there are many new estates with people who commute to Liskeard or Plymouth, which is 17 miles away. The church stands at the highest part of the village. There are three shops, a post office, two inns, a garage and a new school. To the east of St. Cleer is the village of Tremar, divided into Higher Tremar, Tremarcoombe and Lower Tremar. Tremar has a chapel and a village shop. The rest of our area is mainly farm land, with scattered groups of houses.
